triples.name: Adaptive control
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a novel observer-based adaptive fuzzy output-feedback control method that extends adaptive control to handle unknown control gain functions.

triples.name: Backstepping
triples.relevance: Backstepping is the fundamental recursive control design method that the paper builds upon for its output-feedback control scheme.

triples.name: Fuzzy logic
triples.relevance: Fuzzy logic systems are used to design the state observer and adaptive control components in the proposed method.

triples.name: Fuzzy control system
triples.relevance: Fuzzy control systems provide the mathematical framework for the paper's adaptive fuzzy tracking control design.

triples.name: Lyapunov function
triples.relevance: Lyapunov functions are used to construct the logarithm Lyapunov functions and prove stability of the proposed control system.

triples.name: State observer
triples.relevance: State observers are fundamental to the paper's approach for estimating unmeasurable states in output-feedback control.

triples.name: Nonlinear control
triples.relevance: The paper addresses nonlinear control of strict-feedback systems, which is the primary problem domain.

triples.name: Closed-loop controller
triples.relevance: Output-feedback control relies on closed-loop feedback mechanisms to adjust control inputs based on system outputs.
